scan_table_check.description: Each Script Include must be tested and verified through ATF tests. Hence for every Script Include there must be an ATF test that verifies its functionality. An ATF test must exist in the same application as the Script Include that contains the name of the Script Include. Various exceptions are being made for Script Includes that contain standard application functions created by the DevTools AppBuilder function (like Log, Debug, AppGetDependencies etc.). Script Includes which end with "ClientAPI" and are client callable are considered exceptions as they are supposed to be called from the client side and require specific testing approaches. Script Includes ending with "WorkerAPI" should only contain proxy functions and should only be used to start such functions as length background processes and hence are also considered as an exception.
scan_table_check.name: CodeSanity - ATF tests for Script Includes
scan_table_check.resolution_details: Create an ATF test that checks the behavior of the Script Include. Make sure that the name of the Script Include is contained in the name of the ATF test.
scan_table_check.short_description: All Script Includes must be tested by a dedicated ATF test
scan_table_check.sys_name: CodeSanity - ATF tests for Script Includes
